basic.floral_language:
Maranta arundinacea 
Floriography: beautiful, proud, classical
Native to tropical Central and South America, and the West Indies, Maranta arundinacea has beautiful leaves and graceful plant shape. Long oval, thinly leathery leaves with wavy edges, often marked by stripes of various colors.
Maranta arundinacea resists shades, suitable for a bright scattered light. Flowers in winter with white flowers.
basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowers in winter, white flowers
basic.color: Leaf color yellow mixed with green

maintenance.soil: Peat mixed with coarse sand soil
maintenance.sunlight: Like half shade, can take 4-5h moderate light
maintenance.watering: Keep soil moist, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in winter
maintenance.fertilization: Apply low concentration fertilizers, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and summer
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and yellowish leaves timely
